column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2027938^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2027938"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Co-designing a multi-level intervention for improving continuum of care for NCDs in three diverse cities in Nepal
column2: International Collaborations"^"To address the current fragmentation of primary and community health care systems
column3: we will co-design a multi-level intervention to determine what works
column4: and in what dose
column5: frequency and duration to prevent
column6: diagnose and manage risk factors for non-communicable diseases (NCDs). Community health workers will be trained to provide lifestyle counselling and monitoring of people with NCDs
column7: and track and refer them for appropriate care. We will assess both clinical and implementation outcomes."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2032344^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2032344"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Advancing Quality and Safe Virtual Diabetes Care in Emergency Settings (VIRDI)
column2: Targeted Research"^"Diabetes–the fastest-growing chronic condition in Australia–impacts every part of our health system. Indigenous Australians
column3: rural/remote communities and people from culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds are disproportionately impacted by diabetes. Our research will address the gap in access to urgent diabetes care
column4: developing a roadmap for culturally safe virtual specialist support accessible to all Australians experiencing a diabetes-related emergency regardless of geography."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2032615^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2032615"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Does offering a combination of video health and face-to-face visits for antenatal care result in improved patient experience and is it as safe as standard (face-to-face) care? A co-designed non-inferiority randomised controlled trial
column2: Targeted Research"^"Telehealth in pregnancy (where women have some pregnancy appointments with their midwife or doctor by video call instead of face-to-face) has become common in Australia since the COVID-19 pandemic. We will carefully evaluate the use of some telehealth for pregnancy care in a large study to make sure it is safe for pregnant women and their babies
column3: understand the cost implications
column4: and importantly
column5: understand what women think of telehealth and how it affects their experiences and access to care."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2032671^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2032671"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Leveraging NQ telehealth experience for contextually-informed process guidelines to optimise health service access
column2: quality and safety in rural and remote Australia
column3: Targeted Research"^"Use of telehealth in north Queensland has evolved early and rapidly in response to the health service needs of a culturally diverse population spread over a large area. This project maps knowledge about existing telehealth usage
column4: examines strategies for safe and high quality use
column5: including cultural acceptability and co-develops guidelines for health care providers and consumers for the optimal usage of telehealth across north Queensland. This is likely to be applicable across other RRR areas."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2032726^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2032726"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"The general practice and residential aged care study of telehealth augmented holistic care – exploring safety
column2: quality
column3: acceptability and sustainability: "The GRACE-Telehealth Study”
column4: Targeted Research"^"The GRACE-Telehealth study will provide high quality new evidence on the safety
column5: quality
column6: acceptability and sustainability of using telehealth for people living in residential aged care homes (RACHs). It will evaluate telehealth from the perspective of residents
column7: carers
column8: RACHs and GPs
column9: producing decision support for clinicians to choose when telehealth is appropriate and how to use it
column10: and health economic guidance to improve RACH telehealth adoption and resident's access to health services."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2032739^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2032739"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Enabling safe
column2: high quality & high value virtual emergency care in Australia
column3: Targeted Research"^"ED ramping results in delays in access to appropriate health care and distress to patients. Reducing ED ramping by improving the management of patients requiring emergency care is a top priority for the Australian health system. Virtual ED services aim to provide appropriate care for non-life-threatening emergencies in the community. Collaborating with health professionals and consumers
column4: this research aims to inform improvements in the design and application of virtual ED services in Australia."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2032743^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2032743"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Enhancing safe telehealth for all in high risk consultations: a multiperspective
column2: mixed-methods study
column3: Targeted Research"^"This project explores ways to improve the safety of telehealth consultations in primary care
column4: including people with limited English proficiency
column5: through the study of simulated consultations for high-risk medications
column6: using mixed method research. The results of the project will be translated into decision aids for clinicians and consumers addressing medication safety and promotion of shared decision-making
column7: with a particular focus on people with limited English proficiency."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2025089^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2025089"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"The use of Silver Fluoride and Teledentistry to manage and prevent childhood dental decay among Aboriginal children in remote communities
column2: Partnership Projects"^"Access to dental treatment by those living in remote communities is limited to times when an oral health professional team visits the community. We aim to improve access to care by testing the feasibility of using the skills of an Aboriginal Health Worker (AHW)
column3: supported through the use of teledentistry to assess dental decay
column4: and to apply a bactericidal and remineralising solution to decay-affected teeth of children in remote communities to stop the decay and stop new decay forming."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2027453^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2027453"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Translation of precision medicine into clinics for genetic blindness: from diagnosis to clinical management and therapies
column2: Partnership Projects"^"Inherited retinal diseases (IRDs) lead to incurable blindness. They have a profound effect on patients and their families. Targeted therapies now hold the promise of preventing progression of blindness and vision improvement for some forms of IRD. The aims of this project are to determine the cost and quality of life impacts of IRDs
column3: and develop a model to assess the cost effectiveness of routine genomic sequencing and the impact of targeted therapeutic options and reproductive planning in IRDs."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2029534^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2029534"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Levelling the Playing Field: A Scalable Community-wide Strategy to Improve Equity in Access to a Universal Children's Sports Voucher Program
column2: Partnership Projects"^"The SA government’s $100 Sports Voucher scheme aims to help children participate in sports
column3: due to sport's many health
column4: wellbeing and emotional benefits. However
column5: disadvantaged children
column6: who have the most to benefit
column7: are least likely to access it. We will work with stakeholders to evaluate a community-wide strategy to increase Sports Voucher uptake and sports particpation. In future
column8: the program may be scaled up to other disadvantaged communities across SA and nationally."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2030649^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2030649"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"A co-designed approach to reducing the burden of liver disease in First Nations populations in northern Australia: Hep B PAST Plus
column2: Partnership Projects"^"Liver disease can cause liver cancer and death. It is important that people with liver disease know early so that the condition can be managed appropriately. First Nations people in Australia have higher rates of liver disease
column3: especially in the Northern Territory and Far North Queensland. This project will work with those living with liver disease
column4: the community
column5: and health professionals so that First Nations people living with liver disease can live longer and healthier lives."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2030931^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2030931"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Melanoma Population Screening: Using Genomics to Facilitate Risk Stratification
column2: Partnership Projects"^"Melanoma is the third most commonly diagnosed cancer in Australia. Population-wide screening is not feasible
column3: but targeted screening of high-risk individuals is economically viable and improves patient outcomes. We will collaborate with industry and consumers to create personalised risk scores based on genetic and skin damage data. After evaluating impact on consumers
column4: and health economic data
column5: policy experts will determine whether this model meets Australian population screening criteria."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2031038^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2031038"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Delivering best-practice community care for low back pain through an effective national help line
column2: Partnership Projects"^"MSK Australia is Australia’s leading musculoskeletal consumers group. This project will upgrade and evaluate MSK Australia’s existing national Help Line to bridge the gap in community-based support services for patients with low back pain across Australia. If successful
column3: the upgraded Help Line will improve patients’ self-management
column4: and reduce preventable general practitioner and Emergency Department presentations for low back pain."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2032058^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2032058"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"COMPAS-S: Checking on mental health - Providing alternatives to suicide for students
column2: Partnership Projects"^"Every year
column3: nearly 250
column4: 000 Australian university students report suicidal thoughts and behaviours
column5: but are reluctant to seek support. We have developed a novel screening tool that accurately identifies students at increased suicide risk
column6: and proactively reach out to offer safety planning and support. Our initial work shows this is associated with a 41.7% reduction in suicidal behaviour one year later. In this project
column7: we will extend this program to support university students across the country."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2032073^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2032073"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Derivation
column2: Validation and Implementation of a Digital Frailty Index for Acute Care Settings in Queensland
column3: Partnership Projects"^"Currently people who are frail when they go into hospital do not get the right care leading to longer hospital stays and poorer outcomes. Our research team and partners Qld Health
column4: COTA Qld
column5: and IHACPA will test if using data from an electronic medical record can identify how frail a person is when they are first admitted. This electronic data will generate a ‘frailty index’ which could be used by patients
column6: carers
column7: and clinical staff to improve hospital care in Qld hospitals
column8: and Australia-wide."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2032115^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2032115"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Self Regulation RCT in Primary Schools - Understanding the Mechanism and Impact on Wellbeing and Equity
column2: Partnership Projects"^"Self-Regulated Learning is a way for people to take charge of their own learning by setting goals
column3: planning
column4: monitoring
column5: evaluating
column6: and adjusting their strategies. It's important because it can predict how well someone will do in school and in life. A study in Germany showed that a simple and inexpensive program helped young students with self regulation. In South Australia we will see if a modified version of the program can have similar positive effects on student success and wellbeing."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2032120^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2032120"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Novel outcome measures for online youth mental health services
column2: Partnership Projects"^"Outcome measures for online youth mental health services are urgently needed. This research partnership with headspace online youth mental health services will define
column3: design
column4: and test real-time
column5: unobtrusive measures of change in client outcomes and clinician actions derived by machine learning algorithms during online chat -based services. These measures will be built into a clinical support tool for online clinicians
column6: and provide outcome data for measuring service effectiveness."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2032173^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2032173"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Linking young people with disability to participation through cycling: Implementation and evaluation of the co-designed CycLink program
column2: Partnership Projects"^"Children with disability have fewer opportunities to participate in their local communities
column3: harming their health across the lifespan. Cycling is a popular activity in Australia
column4: yet barriers to inclusive community participation exist. Reducing barriers to participation requires accessible supports and collaboration across sectors. We will work in partnership to implement and evaluate a co-designed cycling program to improve participation of children with disability in their local community."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2032346^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2032346"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Improving patient outcomes and reducing the hidden burden of chronic wounds: a digitally enabled Wound Model of Care (The ENABLE Study)
column2: Partnership Projects"^"The cost of chronic wound care to individual Australians and the health care system is untenable. Our aim is to co-develop implementation strategies and then test
column3: evaluate and disseminate an evidence-based
column4: cost-effective digitally enabled model of care involving virtual access to wound specialists and a digital wound application for people with chronic wounds and their clinicians. Our vision is that every person with a chronic wound has access to timely and appropriate specialist wound care."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2032961^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2032961"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Optimising and leveraging technology to improve medication safety
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Despite multimillion dollar investments in IT systems to improve medication safety
column3: medication errors continue to cause harm and death in hospitals and residential aged care. My team has pioneered new ways to identify how and why such large scale IT systems are falling short; and innovative solutions to improve their effectiveness. This project aims to expand and scale up our groundbreaking work to ensure costly IT systems can be optimised to reduce medication errors to save lives and money."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2032970^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2032970"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Upholding our rights to self-determination in tobacco control policy and practice: Indigenous-led solutions to preventable death and disease caused by tobacco
column2: Investigator Grants"^"While most Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people who smoke want to quit
column3: they are less likely to be offered information about smoking cessation or receive culturally appropriate cessation support. As an Aboriginal tobacco control expert
column4: my program of research will advance knowledge about effective tobacco cessation strategies for Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people by privileging Indigenous knowledge and voices."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2032980^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2032980"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Effective community solutions to prevent and treat loneliness
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Loneliness is one of the strongest predictors of poor health. However
column3: we have few effective strategies to treat or prevent loneliness. This project will tackle this problem
column4: capitalising on my expertise as one of the world's foremost loneliness experts
column5: who has already achieved breakthroughs by developing the first program to achieve large improvements in loneliness. This project will involve 3 streams: experimental lab work
column6: studies of prevention in the community
column7: and a large treatment trial."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2032982^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2032982"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"A precision medicine approach to the development of innovative Immunotherapies for Brain Cancer
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Brain cancer defies current treatments
column3: with a dismal 5% 5-year survival rate for glioblastoma and almost no survivors among child brainstem tumour patients. Our research targets three crucial areas: discovering new therapeutic targets
column4: improving CAR T cell immunotherapy safety
column5: and studying the brain tumour environment. Using advanced technologies
column6: we aim to fast-track innovative treatments from the lab to clinical trials."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2032983^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2032983"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Lost Voices: Improving Outcomes for Older Australians with Communication Disability through Identification
column2: Inclusion and Improved Quality of Care.
column3: Investigator Grants"^"Almost 1 million older Australians live with a communication disorder that affects their ability to understand and to be understood. My research aims to improve care and outcomes for these people through better identification of communication needs
column4: training and resources that support inclusion
column5: and quality assessment that drives quality improvement. I will work in partnership with community
column6: industry
column7: and Government to co-design solutions that ensure all older Australians have a voice."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033008^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033008"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Mechanisms to promote lymphatic vessel growth in tissue repair and disease
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Lymphatic vessels drain tissue fluids and traffic immune cells. Recent studies discovered that promoting lymphatic vessel growth improves outcomes in cardiovascular disease
column3: cancer and lymphoedema. A clinical need exists to be able to promote the formation of functional lymphatic vessel networks in patients. This program will characterise mechanisms and methods to promote robust lymphatic formation. Outcomes will inform future therapeutic approaches in lymphoedema and diverse clinical settings."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033012^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033012"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Defining the molecular basis of apoptotic cell disassembly for therapeutic targeting
column2: Investigator Grants"^"In humans
column3: billions of cells are programmed to die every day in various organs as part of normal turnover and disease progression. During cell death
column4: dying cells can disassemble into smaller fragments
column5: a process that could facilitate their removal
column6: as well as mediate communication with other healthy cells. We aim to understand the machinery that control the disassembly of dying cells and the role of this process during viral infections and inflammatory diseases."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033013^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033013"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Research programs and pivotal trials to improve outcomes in critical care medicine.
column2: Investigator Grants"^"One in two Australians will be admitted to intensive care in their life. As global leader in critical care research
column3: I will study our discovery that angiotensin II and sodium ascorbate might save lives. I will combine experimental studies in sepsis and acute kidney injury with pilot and multicentre trials to investigate such treatments. My work will create the background to definitive global practice changing trials to improve clinical decision-making and outcomes for critically ill patients."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033018^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033018"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Identifying and characterising gene regulatory networks of autoimmune diseases at single-cell resolution
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Autoimmune diseases affect over 1 million Australians and pose a high chronic health burden. This group of diseases are highly heritable and the etiology is complex and largely unknown. My research characterises the gene expression patterns in autoimmune diseases and how disease-causal genes interact in the immunologic network. The outcome will facilitate the development of novel treatments and benefit the personalised medicine by tailoring medical care to an individual's unique genetic makeup."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033019^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033019"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Deciphering the genetic landscape of motor neuron disease towards improved outcomes for patients
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS) is a devastating and fatal neurodegenerative disease with no cure. Gene discoveries in ALS can become important diagnostic tools
column3: help to understand the biology of disease
column4: and lead to development of therapies. I will use sophisticated genomics and computational analysis methods to uncover gene defects in both hereditary and sporadic ALS. I will also use deep clinical and biological profiling to develop predictive models of disease progression and prognosis."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033037^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033037"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"A molecular approach to unlocking B cell memory potential
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Memory immune cells are the foundation of vaccine success. They are trained to rapidly clear a reinfection before it can do harm. Yet
column3: we don’t know how long-lasting immune memory is formed
column4: or how chronic viral infections disrupt our ability to form protective immune memory. My research aims to close these knowledge gaps to accelerate the development of new treatments that can significantly reduce the devastating effect of chronic infectious diseases on global health."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033042^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033042"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Tailoring treatment to improve outcome for ovarian cancer patients
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Most women with ovarian cancer survive less than five years from diagnosis. Targeted treatments have improved outlook for some patients
column3: but there remains a substantial proportion with no targeted treatment options. My research focuses on some of the most difficult to treat forms of ovarian cancer. It will identify drivers of cancer growth and match these to effective new treatment combinations. The goal is to extend the benefits of tailored treatment to all ovarian cancer patients."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033054^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033054"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Don't Blow It: Harnessing an Effective and Scalable Drug Prevention Model to Curb Youth Vaping
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Adolescent e-cigarette use (‘vaping’) is now a public health emergency. Effective and scalable prevention programs are urgently needed to upskill and empower youth to make informed health decisions. This research capitalises on a successful drug prevention model to generate crucial new knowledge and an innovative solution to youth vaping that can be immediately disseminated into the community. This will reduce vaping and the associated health

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033069^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033069"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Development of pre-clinical platforms for enhancing antibody quality in vaccine design.

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033081^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033081"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Risk prediction models for time to event data: translating clinical trials into practice

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033083^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033083"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Harnessing plasticity to prevent and treat metastatic and therapy-resistant cancers

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033097^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033097"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Connecting the noncoding genome to breast cancer development

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033119^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033119"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Unleashing the power of AI: Supercharging social media campaigns against youth vaping

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033272^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033272"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Improving atrial fibrillation outcomes
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Atrial fibrillation (AF) is the most common heart rhythm disturbance. It is estimated that a quarter of the adult population over the age of 40 will be diagnosed with AF in their lifetime. AF is associated with increased risk of stroke
column3: heart failure and premature death. It is associated with depression and increases the risk of dementia. The proposed randomised studies will provide new approaches to the routine prevention and treatment of AF and of AF-related complications."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033277^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033277"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"New health economic tools for improving the health and wellbeing of older Australians
column2: Investigator Grants"^"This important and impactful research program will work with key health partners and older patients to develop
column3: validate and implement new health economic measurement tools to assess quality of care and quality of life
column4: supporting a higher quality
column5: efficient and fairer health system for older people. The quality of care experience and quality of life tools will help policy makers and practitioners across health systems world-wide to make better decisions about the care provided to older people."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033280^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033280"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Evidence-based interventions for gaming disorder in adolescents and young adults
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Problem gaming is a major mental health issue that affects more than 300
column3: 000 Australians. This research program will better understand the nature and scale of this problem in Australia and develop co-designed interventions to help young people and parents manage and overcome gaming problems. This project will deliver new knowledge and practical tools and resources to reduce and prevent gaming disorder
column4: promoting better health and social outcomes for vulnerable gamers and their families."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033294^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033294"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Towards Elimination of Avoidable Infections in Surgery
column2: Investigator Grants"^"1 in 10 Australians undergo surgery each year. Infections following surgery are a devastating and avoidable complication. These infections have massive impact - and they can be stopped. My investigator grant studies optimal ways to prevent these infections and to better engage surgical patients in their care and as active research partners. My vision is to ensure the best possible outcomes for surgical patients throughout Australia and internationally."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033297^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033297"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Targeting mitochondrial health in Parkinson's disease through mitophagy
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Mitochondria are essential structures within the cells of our body that generate the energy that sustains life. When mitochondria don’t function properly
column3: it contributes to disease in humans. To better understand of how mitochondria break down and how to fix it
column4: this study will investigate the function of repair pathways that maintain mitochondrial health. The results of this research can be used to identify new points of medical intervention to boost the repair pathways and prevent disease."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033299^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033299"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Optimising the use of antibiotics for sexually transmitted infections to improve antimicrobial stewardship
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Gonorrhoea is a common sexually transmitted infection (STI) with resistance to nearly all the antibiotics used for its treatment globally. The benefits and harms of taking antibiotics to prevent STIs and asymptomatic screening strategies are ambiguous in relation to antibiotic resistance. This research will examine the long-term impact of antibiotic use
column3: trial interventions of reducing screening and co-design resources with clinicians and consumers to decrease antibiotic resistance."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033318^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033318"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Reducing the burden of infectious diseases using translational analytics
column2: Investigator Grants"^"It is now possible to rapidly collect enormous amounts of data on infectious diseases
column3: such as COVID-19. Thus
column4: the challenge now is – “how do we sensibly integrate data across multiple studies to deliver evidence-based policy for managing infectious diseases?” This project aims to use mathematical and data analytics approaches
column5: in close collaboration with local and international experimentalists and clinicians
column6: to guide efforts to reduce the burden of infectious diseases globally."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033319^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033319"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"A working partnership with Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people to address inequities in diabetes and related health conditions
column2: Investigator Grants"^"First Nations Australians bear a disproportionate burden of type 2 diabetes at all ages. My program of work aims to prevent and slow the progression of type 2 diabetes in First Nations children
column3: through early-life prevention: pre-conception
column4: pregnancy
column5: childhood. I lead a partnership of researchers
column6: health services and policy makers across Australia to improve diabetes-related health outcomes with First Nations communities."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033320^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033320"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"New pathways to achieve highly protective and long-lasting malaria vaccines
column2: Investigator Grants"^"This program will advance the development of highly potent and durable malaria vaccines through novel and innovative techniques to identify crucial targets for protective immunity against malaria. We will determine the reasons behind short-lived immunity and develop strategies for new vaccines that offer long-lasting protection with sustained effectiveness. These objectives will be supported by complementary vaccine development and translational activities for new approaches to malaria vaccines."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033323^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033323"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Azithromycin and pneumococcal conjugate vaccine for reducing child mortality in high-risk populations
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Child mortality is unacceptably high in many resource-limited settings: 10 to 20 times higher than in high-income countries. I plan to use widely available cheap interventions - a pneumonia vaccine and the antibiotic azithromycin - targeted to children when they are at their most vulnerable
column3: particularly malnourished children
column4: to reduce child deaths. The work will assess if these interventions combined can multiply the benefit
column5: and will progress discussions towards rollout of the interventions."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033326^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033326"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"How does RNA regulate gene repression?
column2: Investigator Grants"^"When the product of certain genes is not needed
column3: these genes are turned off in a process known as gene repression. Genes are switched off by chromatin modifiers
column4: and the activity of these proteins is influenced by RNA. Previously considered a simple messenger molecule
column5: RNA has emerged as a key player during development and in disease. However
column6: our understanding of how RNA regulates gene repression in vertebrates remains rudimentary. This project aims to determine how RNA affects gene repression."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033338^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033338"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Transforming resource allocation decision-making for obesity prevention
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Excess body weight is a driver of poor health in Australia
column3: contributes to health inequities
column4: and has a large cost burden on society. Government decision-making on which policies and programs to fund to address this complex issue needs to consider the costs
column5: benefits and equity impacts of potential strategies. This project will work with decision-makers to develop the evidence they need to make informed and consistent decisions to improve the health and wellbeing of all Australians."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033340^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033340"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Targeting Glycosylation in Myeloproliferative Diseases
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Myelofibrosis
column3: a cancer of the bone marrow
column4: is currently treated with drugs that target the JAK2 protein. Unfortunately
column5: these drugs have many side-effects
column6: are not curative
column7: and there is no back-up for drug resistant cancers. We are addressing these issues using a multi-pronged approach to understand and target a new biochemical pathway implicated in myelofibrosis. This funding will provide the insights and proof-of-concept data required to drive the development of new drugs for this cancer."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033358^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033358"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Artificial Ion Channels for Advancing Neural Signalling and Treating Neurological Diseases
column2: Investigator Grants"^"This project pioneers multifunctional artificial ion channels to replicate biological ion channels' selective and stimuli-gated ion transport properties
column3: aiming to construct advanced neural devices for managing conditions of neurological disorders like Parkinson's disease
column4: chronic pain
column5: anxiety
column6: and depression. Expected outcomes include new knowledge to enhance our understanding of signal transmission
column7: devices to mimic neuron functions
column8: and tailored therapies for various neurological diseases."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033366^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033366"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Mobile DNA decides neuronal fate in the normal and degenerative human brain
column2: Investigator Grants"^"The brain is a complex and dynamic organ tasked with interpreting and responding to the world around us. My team has shown that various aspects of mobile DNA
column3: or 'jumping gene'
column4: activity can alter brain development and DNA content. This research program will examine why mobile DNA activity appears to be restricted to certain brain cell types
column5: how this phenomenon turns genes on and off
column6: and whether blocking mobile DNA activity in neurodegenerative diseases reduces brain cell death."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033380^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033380"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Developing
column2: translating and implementing biostatistical expertise in stepped wedge cluster randomised trials
column3: Investigator Grants"^"This program will develop novel cluster randomised trial designs to test new interventions in health that will be flexible and robust to the interruptions and delays commonly faced by these trials. Such issues can invalidate trial conclusions. Drawing on my expertise and international network
column4: I will develop new
column5: robust and flexible designs
column6: leading a hub of researchers who are connected with trialists. The hub's statistical work will inform and be informed by cluster randomised trial practice."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033400^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033400"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Neural perturbations in anxiety across development
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Adolescents are vulnerable to anxiety as a result of ongoing maturation in neural systems used to detect safety. Prevailing therapeutic treatments are ineffective for ~50%. My research proposes distinct anxiety profiles arise during adolescence
column3: characterised by amplified threat detection versus blunted safety recognition. This program will build and computationally assess an integrated brain-based model of anxiety. Findings will contribute to new and more effective treatment approaches."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033412^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033412"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"NeoPlatform: Neoadjuvant translational research platform to predict
column2: monitor and enhance response to immunotherapy.
column3: Investigator Grants"^"Drugs that stimulate the immune system to fight cancer (immunotherapy) are more effective when given before surgery (neoadjuvant) than after surgery in patients with locoregional melanoma. We will study >200 patients with melanoma treated in the neoadjuvant setting to predict and monitor response
column4: and to identify personalised treatment for patients resistant to immunotherapy. This work is of major significance to the outcome of patients with cancer."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033415^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033415"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Identification of a genetic-microbial signature for the prevention and treatment of stomach cancer
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Stomach cancer is a major cause of suffering and death globally. While the bacterium Helicobacter pylori is the main risk factor for this cancer
column3: recent evidence suggests that other microbes and genetics also play key roles. We aim to characterise and validate a genetic-microbial signature associated with stomach cancer to identify those at most risk
column4: avoiding the high costs
column5: unintended health consequences and increasing antibiotic resistance rates associated with mass eradication of H. pylori."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033417^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033417"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Understanding and reducing the psychological and physical burden of patellofemoral pain in adolescents and young adults
column2: Investigator Grants"^"This program aims to reduce the psychological and physical suffering caused by chronic knee pain in adolescents and young adults. My proposal is the world’s first in: i) identifying those at highest risk of poor outcomes; ii) discovering features that can be changed to improve treatment; iii) determining the benefits of personalised digital care. Findings will help prevent adolescents and young adults with knee pain from burdening the healthcare system and contribute to a healthier population."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033433^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033433"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Plugging the sodium leak in severe neurodevelopmental disorders
column2: Investigator Grants"^"The sodium leak channel
column3: NALCN plays a crucial role in controlling how our neurons communicate. When there are mutations in the NALCN gene in humans
column4: serious health issues including delayed growth
column5: intellectual disabilities
column6: and early death can occur. Unfortunately
column7: our knowledge of how to develop drugs to treat these diseases is limited. My research aims to find new chemicals to fix the problems with NALCN in these diseases
column8: with the goal of improving the health of affected individuals."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033440^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033440"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Exploration of the skin molecular ecosystem and early melanoma development
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Melanoma can arise from moles or skin without a preexisting mole. We do not currently understand how this happens. This proposal will uncover the mechanism that determines melanoma development. This knowledge has the potential to prevent the excessive excision of benign moles and also improve the early detection of dangerous life-threatening melanoma."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033452^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033452"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Harnessing disease tolerance and immune protection to treat fungal sepsis
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Fungal infections cause 1.5 million deaths world-wide
column3: with limited antifungal treatment options. Therefore
column4: we must think laterally and explore adjunct therapies that can improve infection outcomes. Towards this goal
column5: this project studies how metabolic and nutritional approaches could increase patient survival in fungal infections
column6: which have 20-50% associated mortality. The insight gained could lead to innovative strategies for the treatment of deadly fungal diseases."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033462^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033462"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Profiling of immunotherapy resistant tumours to inform treatment selection and drug discovery for patients with advanced cancer
column2: Investigator Grants"^"This proposal will enable the accurate identification of effective immunotherapy combinations for patients with disease resistance to the standard-of-care immunotherapies. The identification of appropriate treatments in real time will allow patients to avoid unnecessary toxicities and limit costs to patients and the healthcare system. The findings of this research will also have major ramifications for clinical trial design and the treatment of patients with a critical unmet need."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033499^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033499"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Transcriptomics at exquisite resolution
column2: Investigator Grants"^"We now have the technologies to sequence millions of RNA molecules across millions of individual cells. From this we can learn about a variety of diseases including mechanisms that drive cancer and the cells that kill cancer. However these data set are huge and we need robust computational and statistical analysis methods to make sense of this data. This proposal aims to develop computational approaches to analysis that enable deeper understanding of diseases."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033519^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033519"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Improving antidepressant treatment outcomes with personalised circadian medicine
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Sleep and ‘body clock’ disruption create vulnerability for depression. We now know that antidepressants affect sleep and the body clock in a way that has the potential to predict treatment outcomes. This program of research will examine the effect of a range of antidepressants on the body clock in both acute (single) and chronic (multiple) doses
column3: and evaluate the effectiveness of circadian measures for predicting antidepressant treatment responses."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033530^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033530"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Transforming blood transfusion decision-making and patient blood management for and with Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples in rural and remote Australia
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Blood transfusions can benefit patients in certain settings
column3: such as severe anaemia and major bleeding
column4: but can also cause harm. Most existing research on the benefits and risks of blood transfusion is drawn from metropolitan settings and non-First Nations populations. My research will generate new evidence to guide blood transfusion clinical decision-making for First Nations peoples in rural and remote communities
column5: with a focus on the Northern Territory."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033534^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033534"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"The impact of settler-colonial risks on Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander health and the role of culture as a protective factor
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Almost half the health gap in what contributes to poor health for Indigenous peoples is unexplained. This proposal will analyse
column3: for the first time
column4: large-scale data on settler-colonial risk impacts on Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples. This proposal will generate new evidence on the ongoing impacts of colonisation
column5: and protective factors of cultural determinants to equip policymakers and communities to shift the dial on Closing the Gap."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033539^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033539"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Harnessing The Gut Microbiota To Predict And Prevent Life-Threatening Complications Of Haematopoietic Stem Cell Transplantation
column2: Investigator Grants"^"People with blood cancer are often treated with very high doses of chemotherapy which cause a range of nasty side effects some of which are lethal (e.g. infection). This project aims to PREDICT AND PREVENT these side effects. This will be achieved by: i) developing a simple test to detect certain gut bacteria that are known to cause these side effects
column3: and ii) identifying candidate microbes that can be delivered as a specialised probiotic to prevent side effects from occurring all together."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033543^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033543"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Leveraging Uterine-Targeted Nanoparticles for Preventing Preterm Birth
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Thousands of babies could be saved each year by preventing spontaneous preterm birth. Current approaches are hampered by a lack of drug specificity. To address this
column3: we first developed uterine-targeted nanocarriers for targeting interventions to the pregnant uterus. We now seek to leverage this platform to achieve the targeted delivery of multiple advanced therapies possessing the capacity to (re)program uterine smooth muscle cells and silence premature contractions to prevent preterm birth."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033554^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033554"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Liquid biopsy multi-omic approaches to optimise precision medicine in cancer
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Many cancers shed small amounts of DNA (circulating tumour DNA) into the patient’s bloodstream
column3: which exists as a mixture with cell free DNA (cfDNA) fragments released from healthy tissues. Recent technological advances allow levels of circulating DNA to be accurately measured in the blood to understand cancer biology. My research program will advance the use of innovative liquid biopsy approaches to improve disease monitoring and individualise treatment decisions in cancer management."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033557^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033557"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Identifying and targeting epigenetic mechanisms of therapeutic resistance in cancer
column2: Investigator Grants"^"The prevailing dogma in personalised cancer medicine suggests that cancer cell behaviour including the emergence of therapy resistance is primarily due to evolving genetic mutations. My research has challenged this doctrine and shown that epigenetic processes contribute substantially to cancer cell fitness and therapy evasion. My future work will study the interaction between genetic and epigenetic processes in mediating resistance to find new strategies to improve outcomes for cancer patients."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033561^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033561"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Investigating Interventions and Outcomes in the Obesity-related Heart Failure with Preserved Ejection Fraction Phenotype
column2: Investigator Grants"^"My projects will determine whether weight loss in people living with obesity and heart failure will reverse the abnormalities that have developed in the heart. I will also investigate whether a simple
column3: non-invasive procedure – an MRI of the heart – can predict which patients living with obesity will develop heart failure. My work will inform treatment guidelines for patients with obesity and heart failure
column4: to improve their health outcomes."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033569^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033569"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Strengthening evidence on harmful industries and their influence on public health policy
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Government policies to reduce consumption of harmful products like alcohol
column3: tobacco and sugary drinks face strong opposition from industries selling those products. We know little about these opposition strategies. This research program will generate evidence about the political activities of alcohol
column4: tobacco and sugary drink industries and develop a tool to monitor political activities. This will help public health organisations to protect public health policies from industry interference."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033589^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033589"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Strong Skin means Strong Health

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033943^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033943"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Mature neuronal cell culture systems for the study of human disease
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Diseases affecting the brain are often studied using cells cultured in a laboratory

column4: which may not be suitable for studying diseases that affect older adults. This project seeks to identify how cell cultured neurons are different to neurons found in a human brain and uses that knowledge to improve their maturation and similarity to real neurons."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033949^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033949"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Artificial Placenta Development -A New Life Support System for Premature Babies
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Preterm birth is the leading cause of perinatal death and disease in Australia; extremely preterm infants (EPIs) are at the highest risk. column3: obviating the need for pulmonary ventilation. I will simultaneously leverage this unique placental-knockout system to optimize fetal assessments and generate new knowledge for healthy fetal growth and development."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033951^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033951"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Artificial protein circuits and the next generation diagnostics
column2: Investigator Grants"^"To ensure high-quality healthcare we need advancements in disease diagnostics. I will use synthetic biology to develop technologies for detecting and monitoring diseases. These technologies can be used by both doctors and patients through simple devices. By doing so

column4: patients will be able to monitor their conditions on their own

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033958^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033958"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Improving the response to anti-cancer therapy
column2: Investigator Grants"^"While immunotherapy has transformed treatment for some cancer patients

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033961^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033961"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Targeting the protective properties of exercise to prevent and treat heart failure

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033963^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033963"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"ENSURING AUSTRALIANS WITH BACK PAIN RECEIVE THE RIGHT CARE

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033976^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033976"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Understanding the structure and genetic and neurobiological mechanisms of adult psychopathology

column3: I will characterise all the major dimensions of adult psychopathology and their mechanisms
column4: facilitating the development of more effective prevention strategies and therapeutic interventions."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033989^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033989"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Safer oxygen therapy for preterm infants through automated oxygen titration

column5: leading to improved oxygenation and clinical outcomes."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033999^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2033999"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Dissecting the cancer ecosystem as a precision medicine approach towards improving patient outcomes with high-risk melanoma

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034000^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034000"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Next-generation techniques for mapping and modelling brain changes in clinical disorders

column3: advancing our understanding of their causes and informing strategies for future clinical interventions."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034002^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034002"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Enhancing hepatitis C testing

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034008^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034008"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Responding to the burden of chronic diseases attributable to ultra-processed foods in Australia
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Almost half of Australians’ diet comprises ultra-processed foods (UPFs). UPFs have been linked to poor diets
column3: obesity
column4: diabetes
column5: cancer and other diseases in many countries. People are eating more UPFs each year

column7: develop a framework to increase consumer awareness of UPFs
column8: and create and test a warning label to help UPFs identification in Australia."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034017^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034017"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Systematic Identification of Novel Immunotherapy Targets

column3: responses are limited to a subgroup of patients in particular cancer types and patients frequently relapse. This project aims to identify new druggable targets that improve current immunotherapies."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034034^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034034"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Healthy sleep: Advancing the treatment and prevention of insomnia
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Insomnia is the most common sleep disorder
column3: causing significant distress
column4: impairment
column5: and societal burden. The first-line treatment for insomnia is effective but is largely not accessible to the community. Further
column6: there are no current insomnia prevention programs in Australia. This proposal will (1) create new knowledge to inform the treatment and prevention of insomnia
column7: and (2) co-design evidence-based treatment and prevention with stakeholders and community involvement."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034044^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034044"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Illuminating mechanisms of calcium signalling and their role in human disease
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Calcium ions are important molecules that help cells to carry out their functions properly. Our bodies perform this role using calcium-binding proteins
column3: but if this process doesn't work correctly
column4: it can lead to human disease. My research has found new ways that calcium and calcium-binding proteins interact. Using advanced techniques
column5: this project will determine how these interactions function in our body
column6: and how we can therapeutically target these interactions to treat human disease."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034047^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034047"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Harnessing digital technologies to scale trauma-focussed mental healthcare
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Up to 75% of people experience trauma in their lifetime
column3: but many people with trauma-related mental health problems never receive any treatment. We urgently need to improve access to psychological treatment
column4: especially in rural Australia. I will roll-out a new
column5: online
column6: psychological support program which fulfils this need
column7: and deliver new technology to allow large-scale identification of those who need support
column8: alleviating the growing global crises of climate-related natural disasters and war."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034064^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034064"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Investigating host immunity against Cryptosporidium infection to accelerate vaccine development.
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Cryptosporidium parasites are a leading cause of diarrhoea in children. My goal is to fast-track the development of vaccines targeting Cryptosporidium. Using a challenge model
column3: which involves deliberately infecting healthy volunteers
column4: I will study protective responses to infection. I will combine this with animal studies to identify which parasite components trigger these protective responses. This will lead to new understandings of how best to develop vaccines against Cryptosporidium infection."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034082^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034082"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Complementary studies of HIV and Herpes Simplex Viral infection of genital mucosa and the mechanism of action of systemically delivered vaccines

column3: differences and interactions: prior genital HSV infection predisposes to HIV acquisition. Mapping the spread of HIV and HSV viruses in skin to nerves or immune cells and subsequent effects will help guide vaccine development. We will compare these studies with immune responses to delivery of highly effective vaccines into lymph nodes."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034092^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034092"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Investing in the early years to improve social and emotional wellbeing (SEWB) of Aboriginal parents and young people.
column2: Investigator Grants"^"This research focuses on strengthening social and emotional wellbeing (SEWB) and empowering Aboriginal adolescents and post pregnant mothers and their support people including dads. Adolescence and post pregnancy are two life phases which may be stressful
column3: particularly if there is underlying trauma. Empowering Aboriginal adolescents and new parents in designing ways to strengthen SEWB to reduce stress from lateral violence and trauma and propose improved culturally safe family focused services."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034104^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034104"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Killing zombies: the emergence of dead enzymes as therapeutic targets in inflammatory disease
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Every day
column3: millions of our cells undergo an orchestrated cell death. How these cells die can encode additional information
column4: such as to prompt an immune reaction to an invading virus. When one such pathway - necroptosis - is dysregulated
column5: inflammatory diseases
column6: such as inflammatory bowel disease
column7: can arise. Here
column8: we will perform detailed studies to understand how the pathway works on the molecular
column9: cellular and organ scale. Such knowledge will inform ways to drug the pathway therapeutically."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034108^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034108"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Translational Analytics: Integrating experimental and clinical data to understand vaccination and immunity
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Experimental methods have advanced rapidly to improve our understanding of infection and immunity. However

column4: interdisciplinary
column5: collaborative approaches to harness the power of experimental data to inform policy and practice in treatment and control of infectious diseases."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034122^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034122"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Advanced nanoplatform for modulated macrophage phenotype and enhanced gene delivery against bacterial infection
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Bacterial infection

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034130^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034130"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Developing effective

column5: new methods to diagnose children more efficiently
column6: and critical knowledge about how to deliver personalised interventions that reduce lifelong disability."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034141^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034141"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Studying the topology of cancer tissue and its microenvironment to identify topological biomarkers.

column7: much like predicting a building's stability from its blueprint."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034148^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034148"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Reaching Global Targets for HPV Vaccination in Australia: Toward Equity for People with Disability

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034150^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034150"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Improving frailty knowledge and empowering behaviour change via a co-designed Frailty Hub for healthcare consumers and caregivers

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034174^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034174"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Nanocarriers for oral biologic delivery

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034194^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034194"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Transforming clinical care for children with sepsis

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034195^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034195"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Androgen disruption as a novel treatment approach in hormone 'insensitive' cancers

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034202^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034202"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"FRAIL-CVD: a co-designed multi-component intervention to improve frailty and health-related quality-of-life in adults with cardiovascular disease

column5: test and evaluate a novel co-designed intervention to reduce hospital visits and improve frailty and quality-of-life in adults with CVD."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034209^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034209"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Unravelling the Diversity and Function of Tissue-Resident Lymphocytes

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034225^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034225"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Discovery of a novel dopamine circuit that uniquely contributes to methamphetamine use disorder

This research will reveal if this new circuit is a viable target for drug development to treat methamphetamine addiction."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034232^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034232"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Multi-Axial Profile Scores (MAPS): A Personalised Fingerprinting Framework for Improving Diagnosis and Treatment of Psychiatric Disorders

column3: there are currently no clinical decision support tools available for use in child and youth mental health settings.
