column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034258^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034258"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Applying innovative approaches to developing transformational treatments for people with drug resistant epilepsy
column2: Investigator Grants"^"The goal of my research program is to develop life-changing new treatments approaches for people with epilepsy. I will achieve this by harnessing advances in technology and multidisciplinary collaborations to identify treatments that reduce seizures
column3: disability and risk of death or other adverse outcomes in a sustained manner
column4: and innovative ways to predict the outcomes of treatments to enable “precision therapy” targeting of treatments to people who are most likely to benefit from them."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034261^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034261"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Revolutionising equitable health workforce policy and planning in Australia
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Developing a strong health workforce is a national priority. This proposal outlines a novel research program to examine the design and implementation of health workforce policy at federal
column3: state and territory levels. It will map existing policies
column4: identify policy gaps
column5: and examine the influence and impacts of different stakeholders in policy design and implementation. Findings will clarify priority policy targets and effective approaches to achieving equitable and efficient workforce policy."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034266^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034266"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Better feet
column2: better lives: Next generation care for people with diabetes foot disease
column3: Investigator Grants"^"One in 40 people live with diabetes foot disease and often can’t feel pain
column4: ulcers or infections until hospitalised or amputated. Best care prevents half of all hospitalisations and amputations
column5: yet few people get this care. My research will test a number of next generation tools and treatments designed to empower people with diabetes foot disease to better detect
column6: self-care and access best care
column7: for better feet
column8: better lives and a better world with half the hospitalisations and amputations."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034281^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034281"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Deciphering mechanisms underlying breast cancer to improve patient outcomes
column2: Investigator Grants"^"My team has discovered breast stem and progenitor cells that generate the ductal system and provided a single cell breast 'roadmap'. These provide a key framework for identifying regulators of normal development and the earliest changes that occur when a cell becomes cancerous. This research program will provide insights into mechanisms that lead to cancer initiation
column3: progression and drug resistance
column4: using cutting-edge technologies and preclinical models to enable translation to the clinic."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034282^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034282"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Protecting the immunosuppressed from COVID-19
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Through either vaccination or infection
column3: most people now possess some degree of immune protection from COVID-19. However
column4: nearly 2 in 10 people in Australia have some degree of immunosuppression which can leave them susceptible to severe COVID-19. This project aims to link clinical and laboratory data to identify at-risk individuals
column5: develop strategies for the optimal use of vaccines and treatments to protect them from COVID-19
column6: and to inform treatment guidelines to protect the most vulnerable."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034290^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034290"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"A new implementable early burn care intervention strategy for children across Australia
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Children with burns require special
column3: often complex treatments within 24 hours of injury to effectively reduce the impact of injury and minimise chronic physical and emotional scars. Unfortunately
column4: treatments are often not implemented (e.g. first aid)
column5: are too complex (emerging technologies)
column6: or patients are too far away (e.g. in regional and remote areas of Australia). My research aims to test simple new technologies to make sure every child
column7: no matter where they live
column8: gets the best care."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034292^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034292"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Cell type and organelle specific identification of molecular mechanisms initiating and propagating neurodegenerative diseases
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Degeneration starts in the brain long before any clinical symptoms are obvious. This research aims to identify the different organelles within brain cells that become dysfunctional before and after a diagnosis of frontotemporal and Lewy body dementias (more lethal than Alzheimer’s intself) and Parkinson's disease. Analysis of samples from brain donors at different disease stages will determine which organelles are affected before obvious pathology to indicate new treatment opportunities."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034293^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034293"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Molecular basis of cardiac mechanotransduction: Focus on Piezo ion channels
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Mechanical force is increasingly recognised as a major regulator of both cell structure and function with a significant role in pathology of disease. This is especially true for heart and lungs as both are mechanically very active organs. This research will study cellular membrane proteins that convert mechanical force into biological signals
column3: which promises to make significant contribution to our understanding of their role in human health and disease."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034294^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034294"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Enhancing the activity of BH3 mimetic drugs in blood cancers
column2: Investigator Grants"^"To significantly improve outcomes for patients with currently incurable blood cancers (leukaemias
column3: lymphomas
column4: myeloma)
column5: new types of anti-cancer therapy are required. We will build on our past research with venetoclax
column6: the first of a new class of anti-cancer drug
column7: which has recently improved outcomes for people with some leukaemias. Over the next five years
column8: my team will work in the lab and in clinic trials to find ways to enhance the activity of venetoclax and new drugs that work similarly."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034308^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034308"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Using genomics to diagnose and manage patients with inherited cardiac disorders
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Cardiovascular diseases affecting children
column3: adolescents and young adults are often genetic and can have significant burden including risk of sudden cardiac death. Genetic testing is a key part of management
column4: however
column5: only 40% have a genetic cause identified impacting on care of the family. My vision is to apply genomics and genetic counselling equitably
column6: to improve care for all
column7: to clarify diagnosis and refine risk for families with inherited cardiac diseases."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034321^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034321"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Phage therapy: translating research evidence into clinical application
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Phage therapy is promising solution for antibiotic-resistant infections but can sometimes be ineffective in patients. Research suggests that commonly used phages cannot kill certain forms of bacteria called "L-forms"
column3: often present in infections for which phage therapy is recommended. To address this challenge
column4: this project will use advanced technologies to study the complex interactions between bacteria and phages and develop a new generation of phage therapeutics to prevent treatment failure."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034386^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034386"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Reducing the harms associated with inappropriate opioid use before spine surgery
column2: Investigator Grants"^"My research aims to reduce harms caused by the inappropriate use of unnecessary pain medicines. This will be achieved by supporting people undergoing spine surgery for back pain to safely and effectively reduce or stop pain medicines that may be causing more harm than benefit. I will collaborate with people with lived experience
column3: health professionals
column4: and international organisations to ensure my findings are translated into practice to improve the quality of care for Australians with back pain."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034392^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034392"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Balancing the burden and responsibility of fertility between women and men
column2: Investigator Grants"^"For too long the burden of infertility has been placed on women
column3: despite > 50% of infertility cases involving a male factor. In fact
column4: male infertility is now considered a global public health issue
column5: and yet our understanding of its causes remains limited. I will address these knowledge gaps by identifying what regulates a healthy fertilisation competent sperm cell
column6: development of new male contraceptive and how exposures throughout a man’s life might affect the health of the next generation"^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034395^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034395"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Understanding the molecular basis of therapy resistance to improve outcomes for lymphoma
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Non-Hodgkin lymphoma (NHL) is the 6th most common cancer in Australia. Whilst overall survival rates are good for NHL
column3: there are features of certain NHL cancers that are associated with poor therapy responses and poor patient outcomes. I will use innovative pre-clinical models and methodologies to investigate how three poor prognostic features contribute to therapy resistance. Using this information
column4: I will test new anti-cancer therapies that could improve patient survival rates."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034399^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034399"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Enabling precision medicine for oesophageal cancer patients
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Oesophageal adenocarcinoma is a deadly
column3: poor-outcome cancer. We currently do not understand the genetic drivers of disease and lack biomarkers to aid clinical decisions. This program will identify genetic defects that increase disease risk. Molecular analysis and 3D tumour models will assess how these features relate to therapy response and how they can be used to improve outcomes. Deep learning will enhance the interpretation of medical scans and identify new markers related to patient care."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034405^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034405"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Complementary strategies to increase the utility of low-intensity ultrasound as a therapeutic modality for Alzheimer’s disease
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Low-intensity ultrasound will revolutionise the way how we treat brain diseases. Grounded in our work in preclinical Alzheimer models and our recent initiation of a clinical safety trial using a custom-built medical device
column3: the proposed research will provide a better understanding of how different ultrasound parameters differentially affect brain cells and functional outcomes
column4: explore novel ways of gene delivery using ultrasound
column5: and improve therapeutic antibody efficacy using ultrasound."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034406^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034406"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Implementation and evaluation of single dose human papillomavirus vaccination to achieve equitable cervical cancer elimination
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Cervical cancer is preventable but remains the fourth commonest cause of cancer in women globally. Remarkably it now appears that just a single dose of human papillomavirus (HPV) vaccine can prevent it
column3: with Australia moving to one dose in 2023. My research will show that one dose of vaccine is enough
column4: that it can more equitably reach those who are currently under-immunised and co-design and trial an education/communication tool that results in more young people being vaccinated and screened."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034414^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034414"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Making equitable decisions: Embedding appropriate and robust methods for exploring equity impacts in health decision-making processes
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Government funding of a new medicine
column3: health service or public health program may perpetuate or mitigate unfair inequalities in health (i.e. health inequities) but these impacts are not always accounted for in funding decisions. This project will canvas Australian decision-maker and community views on equity and probe Big Data to find a way to comprehensively embed equity in health decision-making. By making equitable decisions
column4: progress towards health for all Australians will be made."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034418^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034418"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Improving infectious diseases outcomes among people who inject drugs
column2: Investigator Grants"^"People who inject drugs (PWID) are more likely to acquire infectious diseases
column3: including bloodborne viruses (such as hepatitis C) and bacterial and fungal injecting-related infections (such as endocarditis). To improve health outcomes
column4: we need to increase hepatitis C diagnosis and treatment
column5: and optimize management of injecting-related infections. I will explore novel diagnostic and treatment strategies among PWID
column6: addressing preventable infections associated with vulnerability and disadvantage."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034420^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034420"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Paradigm-changing strategies to reduce global asthma mortality and morbidity
column2: Investigator Grants"^"This program of work aims to reduce the global burden of death and disability due to asthma
column3: which is largely preventable. It will provide evidence for a simple new way of diagnosing and treating asthma. The new therapy both relieves patients’ symptoms and reduces the risk of severe asthma attacks. The research aims to improve how we assess asthma and respond to patients’ treatment needs
column4: with good quality innovations that are valued by patients and easy to implement in a range of countries."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034422^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034422"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Evidence generation for a national melanoma prevention and early detection strategy
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Melanoma and skin cancer diagnoses place a heavy physical
column3: emotional
column4: and financial toll on many Australians and their families. This program of research will provide the evidence for how Australia can move toward a targeted melanoma screening program for those at highest risk
column5: and improve the reach and relevance of personalised skin cancer prevention. Together this will lead to a significant reduction in melanoma incidence
column6: morbidity and mortality."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034424^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034424"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Improving kidney outcomes for critically ill patients with vasodilatory shock
column2: Investigator Grants"^"‘Vasodilatory shock’ is a life-threatening medical emergency characterised by low blood pressure and impaired oxygen delivery to tissues. Kidney failure is a common and serious complication of vasodilatory shock that is highly burdensome to patients. This research program will test whether a new medication (‘angiotensin II’) improves kidney outcomes in patients with vasodilatory shock. Its findings could change management globally
column3: transforming the lives of this highly vulnerable patient group."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034431^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034431"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Exploiting the diversity of tissue-resident memory T cells for novel therapies
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Diseases mostly originate in organs not blood
column3: therefore therapies should focus on boosting immune cells in these sites. Specifically
column4: tissue-resident memory T cells (TRM) in organs rapidly protect against infection & cancer but may contribute to autoimmunity. Here
column5: I will explore TRM diversity & molecular cues that govern their behaviour in disease-specific contexts to uncover novel pathways that can precisely target ‘pathogenic’ TRM while preserving ‘protective’ TRM."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034433^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034433"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Across the blood-brain barrier: digital profiling of circulating brain-derived extracellular vesicles to monitor primary brain cancer and brain metastases
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Despite therapeutic advances
column3: the global cancer burden is steadily rising
column4: with 1 in 5 men and 1 in 6 women developing cancer in their lifetime. This makes cancer one of the leading causes of death worldwide. There is a clinical need to identify patients at early-stage risk of cancer metastases or progression. To achieve this
column5: this project aims to develop a technology for cancer detection from the blood that is highly accurate and can be implemented in routine screening."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034450^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034450"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Improving health outcomes for transgender women
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Transgender Australians are arguably among the most marginalised groups in our community. Despite a significant increase in the number of individuals seeking medical care
column3: there is a profound lack of research to guide optimal gender-affirming hormone therapy interventions. This project will provide robust evidence to improve the health and well-being of the transgender community to improve the safety of gender-affirming therapy and guide treatment guidelines."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034451^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034451"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Improving the understanding and management of chronic wet cough and its associations in children
column2: Investigator Grants"^"A large proportion of lung disease in adults begins in childhood and so early intervention is the key to reducing lung health burden. My research program aims to identify modifiable factors which will improve the understanding and management of chronic wet cough in preschool children. It will also look at associations with wheeze and asthma within this group of children with cough. I expect it to provide new clinical strategies for managing these common early childhood healthcare presentations."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034453^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034453"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Beyond the Cancer Care Divide: achieving First Nations health equity
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Indigenous Australians carry a significantly greater cancer burden than other Australians and are less likely to receive comprehensive cancer treatment and care. Working alongside Indigenous people affected by cancer
column3: my program targets key gaps across the cancer continuum
column4: from preventative screening programs to end-of-life care. My research aims to improve cancer experiences and outcomes for Indigenous patients and their carers
column5: giving them the best chance to not just survive but to thrive."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034478^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034478"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Management of musculoskeletal pain: testing treatment effectiveness and reducing medication-related harm
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Pain of the muscle
column3: bone and joint (musculoskeletal) system represents a major cause of disease burden. There is a lack of highly effective treatments while some treatments
column4: such as opioids
column5: are being used with no clear evidence of benefits but known harms. I will lead a research program to address the enormous burden of musculoskeletal pain
column6: by providing evidence for treatment effectiveness and for reducing unnecessary medication-related harm."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034480^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034480"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Improving health outcomes for sick and premature infants
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Asphyxia (lack of oxygen) and prematurity (being born early) are the most important health issues for newborn babies
column3: affecting millions globally every year. These issues can have life-long consequences for babies and their families. My research will identify new ways to treat these babies in early life
column4: whether they are born in large intensive care units in major cities
column5: or smaller regional neonatal units. Improving early care can translate into better health in childhood and beyond."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034488^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034488"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Immune Dashboard Chip (IDC): Single-molecule digital nanotechnology for profiling trace immune dysregulations in Long COVID-19 and improving mRNA vaccines
column2: Investigator Grants"^"The immune system is a finely balanced process that builds our defence against diseases. Even low-level dysregulations of the immune system
column3: such as those thought to drive long COVID
column4: can cause severe suffering. This project develops a digital nanotechnology capable of detecting trace immune dysregulation from a pin-prick of blood. This will lead to a better understanding
column5: diagnosis
column6: and treatment of long COVID and the development of personalised vaccines with greatly reduced side effects."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034489^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034489"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Advancing clinical trials towards a cure for HIV
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Human Immunodeficiency Virus (HIV) infection is a chronic disease that can't be cured
column3: requiring life-long treatment. This research program aims to help identify people with HIV who are best suited to enrol in clinical trials to test drugs that may allow someone to keep HIV at very low levels in their blood without medications. This could lead to HIV remission or cure. I will do this by incorporating clinical and social science research projects to design safe and effective trials in this field."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034497^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034497"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"The critical role of circadian rhythms disruption on the pathophysiology of metabolic diseases
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Our body clock orchestrates our physiology
column3: including when we eat and sleep
column4: synchronizing it with the daily changes in our environment and the alteration of day and night. Modern western lifestyles
column5: technology and shift work disrupt our body clock. This disruption is associated with many diseases including obesity
column6: liver diseases and cancer
column7: but the mechanisms responsible are poorly understood. My research will decipher how disruption of the body clock leads to liver and metabolic diseases."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034498^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034498"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Improving sustainability and equity of youth physical activity initiatives at scale
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Just one in 10 young people in Australia meet national physical activity guidelines of an hour a day. Those who are socially disadvantaged are the most inactive. This research program will determine how to improve the uptake and delivery of youth physical activity programs nationally
column3: so that they are more effective and sustainable in the long term and can reduce inequalities in participation. This new evidence will underpin large-scale initiatives to benefit all young people in Australia."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034513^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034513"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Addressing Critical Knowledge Gaps to Improve Outcomes in Ovarian
column2: Endometrial and Thyroid Cancers
column3: Investigator Grants"^"Cancer is the leading cause of disease burden in Australia
column4: but this could be reduced with effective cancer prevention and ensuring patients receive the best evidence-based care. My research program focusses on three relatively common but understudied cancers: ovarian
column5: endometrial and thyroid cancer. My research will identify new causes of these cancers to improve their prevention and will find ways that we can optimise the care patients receive and improve their outcomes."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034520^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034520"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Personalising brain care in preterm babies

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034533^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034533"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Understanding how regulatory T cells control self-reactive B cells in autoimmune diseases

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034538^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034538"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"The dangerous path of self-medicating postpartum stress and anxiety with alcohol: Intervening early to improve the health and wellbeing of both mother and child

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034541^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034541"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Opioid stewardship for patients undergoing hip and knee replacements

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034556^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034556"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Bridging discovery and translation to target the genetic control of complex diseases at a cellular level

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034568^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034568"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Enabling genetics-based disease risk prediction in Australia

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034583^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034583"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Measuring what Matters to Australian Mothers: The MMAMs Study

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034591^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034591"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Harnessing Small Extracellular Vesicles for Precision Periodontics

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034592^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034592"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Innovating diagnostics

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034593^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034593"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Molecular and cellular requirements for generating long-lived adaptive humoral immunity in humans

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034599^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034599"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"The Visual System: A Window into Glial Dynamics and Neuroinflammatory Pathways in Neurodegenerative Diseases

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034602^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034602"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"The right to know: Addressing health-related information deficits in online purchasing contexts

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034615^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034615"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Advancing the evidence-base in cardiac arrest and resuscitation

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034631^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034631"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Strengthening primary health systems through Australian Indigenous paradigms: self-governance for healthy Country and community wellbeing

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034633^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034633"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"AT RISK – A Novel Neurophysiological Approach to Biomarkers in Neurodegeneration

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034643^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034643"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Malaria and development of new antimalarials

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034644^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034644"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Novel strategies for global control of meningococcal disease and gonorrhoea

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034651^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034651"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"New-generation superbright upconversion nanoprobes for ultrasensitive microRNA detection

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034770^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034770"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Systematic reviews of aetiology and risk factors of disease: a program of methodological research

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034788^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034788"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Building the knowledge base for effective stigma reduction interventions in health care

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034857^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034857"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Innovative Chemoimmunotherapy for Metastatic Castration-Resistant Prostate Cancer
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Prostate cancer is a significant health concern both in Australia and globally. Many individuals undergoing hormone therapy eventually develop advanced prostate cancer that resists treatment. To tackle this issue

column4: integrating chemotherapy and immunotherapy. The goal is to enhance the effectiveness of treatment for advanced prostate cancer while reducing unwanted side effects."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034904^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034904"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Using internet searches and digital advertising to intervene during suicidal ideation
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Suicide is a leading cause of death in Australia

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034925^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034925"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Advancing the science of evidence synthesis: developing standards

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034943^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034943"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Preventing Psychotic Disorders Using Artificial Intelligence

Cutting-edge artificial intelligence techniques will be used with a vision to reform care by personalizing preventative therapies."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034945^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034945"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Harnessing Nanotechnology to Develop Next-Generation mRNA Oral Vaccines

column4: market-ready oral vaccine nanotechnology with business advantages will be generated to improve the reach and acceptability of emerging vaccines to treat infectious and chronic diseases."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034960^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034960"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Strategic Development of a Trial Culture for Surgical Innovation and Evaluation: A Node Catalyst Model

column4: benefit and value assessment

column6: plastic
column7: liver and vascular surgery. These specialty areas will act as examples for others to follow. The result will be an increase in surgical trials in Australia."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034965^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034965"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Development of a dissolvable antibacterial microneedle patch for deep wound biofilms

column3: self-administrable antibacterial microneedle that can precisely access biofilm infections to eliminate them while initiating mechanisms to support wound healing. This technology will provide targeted
column4: safe
column5: and effective solution for all forms of resistant infections."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034976^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034976"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Data driven approaches to outsmart skin cancer

column3: however a standardised approach to diagnosis does not currently exist
column4: nor is it possible to monitor quality of care. My research will enable development and validation of cutting-edge technologies to standardise diagnosis and optimise care. Emerging technologies will be used to identify significant variations in care."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034989^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2034989"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Optimsing the scale-up of evidence-based tools for control and local elimination of dengue
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Dengue is a viral disease spread by mosquitoes. Regular large outbreaks in tropical settings place a strain on communities and health systems
column3: and conventional approaches for controlling mosquitoes have been ineffective. My research will examine the real-world impact of two new effective tools for dengue control - Wolbachia mosquito releases and a vaccine - in Indonesia and Fiji
column4: and generate evidence to support their scale-up to protect communities from dengue and other mosquito-borne diseases."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2035021^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2035021"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Exploring the Boundaries of Nuclear Reprogramming
column2: Investigator Grants"^"This research aims to understand "nuclear reprogramming" - a process that can change a cell’s identity. I hope to find new ways to treat diseases and health problems. I am especially interested in how cells keep their identity and how amenable they can be in changing it. This knowledge can help us improve cell-based treatments and even fight cancer by reverting harmful cells into harmless ones. In short
column3: this work could transform how we approach treatments in regenerative medicine and cancer."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2035037^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2035037"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Long-read sequencing methods and resources for genomic medicine
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Cutting-edge long-read sequencing (LRS) technologies provide a more complete picture of the human genome than previously possible. There are countless opportunities to streamline
column3: improve or reimagine disease diagnosis using LRS. I will develop a collaborative research program that will lead LRS innovation and impact in Australia. My program will deliver new knowledge
column4: resources and tools for genomic medicine
column5: and support the biomedical community with access to the latest LRS advances."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2035040^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2035040"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Faster health solutions for today's children and adults
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Many children are not thriving and life expectancy is falling. For long and healthy lives
column3: we need new strategies to help children and midlife adults to flourish
column4: prevent illness and effectively manage complex 21st century problems. Leveraging >$90 million of establishment and research funding
column5: my program will harness the power of Australia’s new Generation Victoria cohort (final expected n ~150
column6: 000) into a discovery and intervention pipeline to improve the health and wellbeing of our nation."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2035042^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2035042"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Exploiting epigenetic memory and manipulation to advance cell biotechnologies and disease treatment
column2: Investigator Grants"^"The epigenome is essential for cell function
column3: is disrupted in disease
column4: and can store memories of a cell's past. This project will determine how cells remember their past and how to erase this memory to better engineer them; create new tools for adjusting gene activity to improve disease treatments; and investigate epigenome disruption during development in neurological disorders. This will unlock improved cell therapy tools and better understanding of diseases
column5: underpinning future therapies."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2035090^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2035090"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Venoms to drugs: translating venom peptides into human therapeutics
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Many disorders of the nervous system
column3: including intractable chronic pain and epilepsy
column4: result from the aberrant activity of ion channels that ferry sodium and potassium ions across neuronal cell membranes. There are very few drugs available for treating some of these disorders and they often have debilitating side-effects. We are using animal venoms to develop potent and selective modulators of these ion channels as the next-generation of safe and effective pain killers and anti-epileptic drugs."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2035111^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2035111"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Connecting Patients to Cancer Rehabilitation: Delivering CaRe at the right place and time using the Cancer Rehabilitation to Recreation (CaReR) Framework
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Exercise-based rehabilitation essential to cancer treatment and recovery. However
column3: just 1 in 200 people can access exercise-based cancer rehabilitation. People struggle to return to their previous function which negatively affects their quality of life. My research program leverages my previous work to identify the needs of patients and doctors to access services and evaluate a framework to connect more patients to cancer rehabilitation that can be adapted to cancer centres nationwide."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2032153^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2032153"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Extending lifespan and healthspan: A 40-year prospective cohort study of early life determinants of leading causes of mental disorder and chronic disease burden in populations.

column5: Generation 2 will enter their 40s
column6: and Generation 3 will turn 10. This provides a rare opportunity examine the earlier life determinants of mental disorders and physical disease in middle and later life as well as across generations."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2032163^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2032163"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"ISAAC - Invasive Streptococcus A: a randomised control trial of antibiotic prophylaxis for contact management
column2: Clinical Trials and Cohort Studies"^"Invasive group A streptococcal disease (iGAS) causes more deaths in Australia than meningococcal disease. iGAS is becoming more common in Australia and overseas. column3: a national approach to preventing iGAS among household contacts is lacking. Findings from this trial will clarify when household contacts need antibiotics to prevent further iGAS cases
column4: and which antibiotics to use."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2032210^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2032210"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Atrial Myopathy and Embolic Stroke (AMES) trial
column2: Clinical Trials and Cohort Studies"^"This unique world-first project targets a significant area of unmet need by identifying a relatively new but common cause of stroke

column5: facilitating earlier detection and treatment. There will substantial health impact should our trial show that anticoagulation in atrial myopathy reduces stroke recurrence and cognitive decline."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2032228^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2032228"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Radiation doses and fractionation schedules in non-low-risk ductal carcinoma in situ in the breast (BIG 3–07/TROG 07.01): a randomised
column2: factorial
column3: multicentre
column4: open-label
column5: phase 3 study
column6: Clinical Trials and Cohort Studies"^"DCIS within milk ducts may turn into invasive breast cancer if untreated. The 5-year results of our study of 1608 women shows that after surgery

column8: and explore their lived experiences to support shared treatment decision-making."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2032302^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2032302"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Treatment Of early gestational diabetes Mellitus: THe follow-Up of Mothers and Babies future cardio-metabolic risk and neurodevelopment (TOMTHUMB)

This research will discover if it also reduces long-term risks of diabetes and obesity in mother or baby. We will take metabolic measurements in mothers and offspring over 5-7 years to determine the benefits or harms of treating early GDM and to compare immediate versus deferred treatment. This definitive study will inform GDM screening
column3: diagnostic and practice policies globally."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2032328^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2032328"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"The 24-hour physical behaviour spectrum for cancer prevention: associations with cancer incidence and mortality in the ProPASS consortium of prospective wearables-based cohorts
column2: Clinical Trials and Cohort Studies"^"Physical activity
column3: sitting and sleep - termed “physical behaviours” - are major determinants of risk for many cancers
column4: although we do not know what the minimal and optimal amounts for cancer prevention are. This project will use the wearable device data derived from the ProPASS consortium to examine the combined associations of physical activity
column5: sitting and sleep with cancer risk. The aim is to provide precise evidence that will contribute to future cancer prevention guidelines."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2032361^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2032361"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Randomised double blind placebo controlled trial of oral lisdexamfetamine for methamphetamine withdrawal
column2: Clinical Trials and Cohort Studies"^"Australia has the highest rate of methamphetamine (MA) dependence globally. Cessation of regular MA use leads to symptoms of withdrawal
column3: which perpetuate drug use and can prevent help-seeking. There is no treatment for MA withdrawal. We will conduct a clinical trial using a stimulant medication already used to treat attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder in Australia. Lisdexamfetamine has the potential reduce withdrawal symptoms and become the first treatment for MA withdrawal in the world."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2032362^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2032362"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"The Aboriginal Families Study (Wave 3) grounded in Aboriginal knowledge and culture: Exploring Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander young people’s social and emotional wellbeing

column3: mental health

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2032384^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2032384"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"PROMOAT: An Adaptive Platform Trial of Antibiotic Therapy to Improve Outcomes from Preterm Prelabour Rupture of Membranes
column2: Clinical Trials and Cohort Studies"^"Preterm birth can lead to death and life-long disability. In nearly half of preterm births
column3: the mother "breaks her waters" before the onset of labour

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2032407^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2032407"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Precision Medicine in Liver Cancer a National Consortium for Spatial and molecular Phenotyping of HCC
column2: Clinical Trials and Cohort Studies"^"This project aims to bring precision medicine
column3: a treatment approach tailored to individual patients

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2032420^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2032420"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Randomized controlled trial of thrombectomy versus standard medical therapy for stroke with medium sized vessel occlusion: Frontier-AP

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2032421^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2032421"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Testing an implementable strategy to modulate immune function and reduce inflammation to prevent asthma and preserve lung function: 6-year follow-up of the existing VITALITY RCT.

column4: can prevent asthma and lung function deficits. This trial may change global infant nutrition recommendations and reduce the lifelong effects of respiratory disease. This is an age 6 years follow-up study of our large NHMRC funded trial
column5: VITALITY

column7: and is testing if this intervention (vitamin D) can prevent food allergy and eczema at age 1."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2032441^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2032441"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"P3BEP Trial - Accelerating First-Line Chemotherapy to Improve Cure Rates for Advanced Germ Cell Tumours - An Australian-Led

column3: Clinical Trials and Cohort Studies"^"Advanced germ cell tumours such as testicular cancer typically affect young people

column6: Etoposide Cisplatin

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2032444^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2032444"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Staphylococcus aureus bacteraemia treated with phage therapy to improve outcomes (SABRE-Phi trial)

This trial will investigate use of a locally produced 2-phage combination (cocktail) that targets the golden staph bacteria to see if it provides an advantage in addition to antibiotics in treating patients with severe golden staph bloodstream infections."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2032454^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2032454"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Next Generation Therapeutic Brain Stimulation for Depression

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2032492^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2032492"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"South Australian Aboriginal Cancer Cohort Study to Improve Cancer Management and Outcomes

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2032498^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2032498"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Enhancing work participation after stroke: supporting regional and rural Australians

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2032516^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2032516"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Early Pain Intervention after total Knee replacement (EPIK): a registry-nested trial
column2: Clinical Trials and Cohort Studies"^"Total Knee replacement (TKR) is a common surgical procedure that aims to improve pain and quality of life in people with severe arthritis of the knee. However
column3: one in four people have persistent
column4: pain after TKR. We have developed a model of cae (EPIK) to improve outcomes for people with persistent pain after TKR
